name: MedicationDispense
description: Indicates that a medication product is to be or has been dispensed for a named person/patient.  This includes a description of the medication product (supply) provided and the instructions for administering the medication.  The medication dispense is the result of a pharmacy system responding to a medication order.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: Identifiers associated with this Medication Dispense that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: partOf
elements.short: Event that dispense is part of
elements.description: The procedure that trigger the dispense.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.short: preparation | in-progress | cancelled | on-hold | completed | entered-in-error | stopped | declined | unknown
elements.description: A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.

binding.description: A coded concept specifying the state of the dispense event.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: statusReason[x]
elements.short: Why a dispense was not performed
elements.description: Indicates the reason why a dispense was not performed.

binding.description: A code describing why a dispense was not performed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: category
elements.description: Indicates the type of medication dispense (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient)).

binding.description: A code describing where the dispensed medication is expected to be consumed or administered.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: medication[x]
elements.description: Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

binding.description: A coded concept identifying which substance or product can be dispensed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: subject
elements.description: A link to a resource representing the person or the group to whom the medication will be given.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: context
elements.description: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this event.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .inboundRelationship[typeCode=COMP].source[classCode=ENC, moodCode=EVN, code="type of encounter or episode"]

elements.name: supportingInformation
elements.short: Information that supports the dispensing of the medication
elements.description: Additional information that supports the medication being dispensed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .outboundRelationship[typeCode=PERT].target[A_SupportingClinicalStatement CMET minimal with many different choices of classCodes(ORG, ENC, PROC, SPLY, SBADM, OBS) and each of the act class codes draws from one or more of the following moodCodes (EVN, DEF, INT PRMS, RQO, PRP, APT, ARQ, GOL)]

elements.name: performer
elements.description: Indicates who or what performed the event.

elements.name: function
elements.short: Who performed the dispense and what they did
elements.description: Distinguishes the type of performer in the dispense.  For example, date enterer, packager, final checker.

binding.description: A code describing the role an individual played in dispensing a medication.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: actor
elements.description: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed the action.  It should be assumed that the actor is the dispenser of the medication.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: location
elements.description: The principal physical location where the dispense was performed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: authorizingPrescription
elements.short: Medication order that authorizes the dispense
elements.description: Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.short: Trial fill, partial fill, emergency fill, etc.
elements.description: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. For example, Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

binding.description: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. For example, Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: quantity
elements.description: The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: RXD-4-Actual Dispense Amount / RXD-5.1-Actual Dispense Units.code / RXD-5.3-Actual Dispense Units.name of coding system

elements.name: daysSupply
elements.short: Amount of medication expressed as a timing amount
elements.description: The amount of medication expressed as a timing amount.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: TQ1.6 Timing/Quantity Segment Service Duration.Prior to v2.5, ORC.7.3 Common Order Segment / Quantity/Timing / Duration component.  This is a formatted string, first character for the time unit (e.g., D=days), followed by the value.  For example, “D14” represents “14 days supply”From v2.5 on, TQ1.6 Timing/Quantity Segment / Service Duration.  This is a CQ data type (<Quantity (NM)> ^ <Units (CWE)>), thus for days supply, assuming the unit of measure is “days”, the numeric value is TQ1.6.1 (…|14^For backwards compatibility, ORC.7 was permitted through v2.6.  Both forms (field and segment) may be present in v2.5, v2.5.1, and v2.6

elements.name: whenPrepared
elements.short: When product was packaged and reviewed
elements.description: The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: whenHandedOver
elements.description: The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: destination
elements.description: Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: RXD-13 Dispense-to Location; RXD-30 Dispense to Pharmacy; RXD-31 Dispense to Pharmacy Address

elements.name: receiver
elements.description: Identifies the person who picked up the medication.  This will usually be a patient or their caregiver, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: note
elements.description: Extra information about the dispense that could not be conveyed in the other attributes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: dosageInstruction
elements.short: How the medication is to be used by the patient or administered by the caregiver
elements.description: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: substitution
elements.short: Whether a substitution was performed on the dispense
elements.description: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense.  In some cases, substitution will be expected but does not happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen.  This block explains what substitution did or did not happen and why.  If nothing is specified, substitution was not done.

elements.name: wasSubstituted
elements.short: Whether a substitution was or was not performed on the dispense
elements.description: True if the dispenser dispensed a different drug or product from what was prescribed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.short: Code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed
elements.description: A code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed.

binding.description: A coded concept describing whether a different medicinal product may be dispensed other than the product as specified exactly in the prescription.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reason
elements.description: Indicates the reason for the substitution (or lack of substitution) from what was prescribed.

binding.description: A coded concept describing the reason that a different medication should (or should not) be substituted from what was prescribed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: responsibleParty
elements.short: Who is responsible for the substitution
elements.description: The person or organization that has primary responsibility for the substitution.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: detectedIssue
elements.description: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: eventHistory
elements.short: A list of relevant lifecycle events
elements.description: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred, such as when the dispense was verified.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
